Package com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Class LogOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.LogOptions
  • public class LogOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to specify the logging options in SweetBlue. There are two types of logs SweetBlue will print. The first are SweetBlue logs that have to do with SweetBlue logic, the other are "native" logs, which print when SweetBlue receives any callbacks from the native stack. Each of these two types can then specify the log level to be printed (Use LogOptions.LogLevel to pick with ones you would like to see). You can also use OFF to shut all logging off, ON to turn on most helpful logs, and ALL_ON to turn all logging on for convenience (this one can cause performance issues during scanning, as it will print a log every time a device is seen).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  LogOptions.LogLevel
      Enumeration for setting the log level of SweetBlue's logger.

    • Field Detail

      • OFF

        public static final LogOptions OFF
        Static instance for conveniently shutting off all logging.

      • ON

        public static final LogOptions ON
        Static instance for turning on most logging. This sets the log level at LogOptions.LogLevel.DEBUG for both SweetBlue and native logs.

      • ALL_ON

        public static final LogOptions ALL_ON
        Static instance for turning ALL logging on. This will affect performance during scanning, as every time a device is seen, it will print a log entry.
